message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

The paper presents a state estimator for a monocular visual-inertial system, which is applicable for different applications that require high accuracy in localization. The paper involves robotics (cs.RO) as it deals with state estimation for a robot using visual and inertial sensors. Computer vision (cs.CV) is also relevant as the system uses feature observations from a camera. Machine learning (cs.LG) is mentioned in the paper as a possible future direction for improving the system. Control systems (cs.SY) is relevant as the system involves tightly coupled, nonlinear optimization-based methods for obtaining accurate odometry. Artificial intelligence (cs.AI) is also relevant as the system involves loop detection and global pose graph optimization.
